story1.title: The Stolen Necklace
story1.description: A valuable necklace was stolen from a museum. The security guard, the janitor, and the curator were all questioned. Each gave their alibi: The security guard said he was checking the cameras. The janitor said he was cleaning the storage room. The curator said she was giving a tour to a group of visitors. However, the museum was closed for maintenance that day, and no tours were scheduled. Who is lying?
hints: Consider the museum's schedule on that day.
Only one person mentioned a tour.

story2.title: The Late-Night Call
story2.description: A businessman was found dead in his office late at night. The police questioned the secretary, the janitor, and his assistant. The secretary said she was at home answering emails. The janitor said he was cleaning the floors. The assistant said he was out grabbing coffee. However, the security footage showed that the office doors were locked from the outside all night. Who is lying?
hints: Think about access to the office after hours.
No one could have entered once the doors were locked.

story3.title: The Missing Book
story3.description: A rare book went missing from the library archives. When questioned, the librarian, assistant, and a visitor gave the following accounts. The librarian said she was organizing the books. The assistant said he was filing paperwork. The visitor said he was reading in the archives. The archives section was under lock and key, with only the librarian having access. Who is lying?
hints: Consider who has access to the archives.
The visitor couldn't have been in a locked area.

story4.title: The Vanished Painting
story4.description: A painting disappeared from a gallery, and three staff members were questioned: the curator, the janitor, and a guard. The curator said he was preparing for an exhibition. The janitor said he was cleaning the basement. The guard said he was patrolling the exhibit halls. However, it was discovered the basement was flooded and off-limits that day. Who is lying?
hints: Remember the state of the basement that day.
One person mentioned working in an off-limits area.

story5.title: The Mysterious Robbery
story5.description: During a jewelry store robbery investigation, the police questioned three suspects: the cashier, the security guard, and a customer. The cashier said she was organizing the display. The security guard said he was taking a break. The customer claimed he was browsing. However, the store's policy does not allow anyone, even the guard, to leave their post during business hours. Who is lying?
hints: Think about the store's policy for guards.
The security guard shouldn’t have left his post.
